courses.name: Eating and Drinking Across Global Asia

cmCourseInfo.description: Students examine historical themes for local and regional cuisines across Global Asia, including but not limited to Anglo-Indian, Arab, Bengali, Chinese, Himalayan, Goan, Punjabi, Japanese, Persian, Tamil, and Indo-Caribbean. Themes include religious rituals, indigenous foodways; colonialism, industrialization, labour, gender, class, migration, globalization, and media. Tutorials are in the Culinaria Kitchen Lab. Same as FSTC54H3 and HISC54H3
cmCourseInfo.title: Eating and Drinking Across Global Asia
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Any 4.0 credits, including 0.5 credit at the A- or B-level from CLA, FST, GAS, HIS or WST courses

notes.name: Course Note

Enrolment Indicator: P

Initially Restricted to students in the following groups:
Year 3 - SCMAJGAS - Major Program in Global Asia Studies
Year 3 - SCMINGAS - Minor Program in Global Asia Studies
Year 3 - SCSPEGAS - Specialist Program in Global Asia Studies
Year 4 - SCMAJGAS - Major Program in Global Asia Studies
Year 4 - SCMINGAS - Minor Program in Global Asia Studies
Year 4 - SCSPEGAS - Specialist Program in Global Asia Studies

Enrolment will open to all UTSC students on April 3, 2024, 6am. Enrolment will open to UTSG and UTM students on April 9, 2024.
